p: In a cohort of 53 severely ill COVID-19 patients treated with remdesivir and observed for 18 days, 68% of patients improved in oxygen-support status, with a mortality of 13% overall ( 116). In a preliminary report of a randomized trial of 1,059 patients with COVID-19, those who received remdesivir had a faster recovery than patients who received a placebo ( 90). Goldman et al. ( 117) found that in 397 severe COVID-19 pneumonia patients without mechanical ventilation at baseline, there was no significant difference if they were treated for 5 or 10 days. However, in a randomized clinical trial of 158 patients, remdesivir was not associated with a significant clinical improvement compared to the placebo group comprised of 78 patients ( 91). Numerous clinical trials are ongoing to test remdesivir and its safety against COVID-19 infection.
